verses.kjv: Observe the month of Abib, and keep the passover unto the LORD thy God: for in the month of Abib the LORD thy God brought thee forth out of Egypt by night.
verses.ct: Pay attention to the month of Abib and celebrate the Passover to the LORD your God, because it was during the month of Abib that the LORD your God brought you out of Egypt at night.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt therefore sacrifice the passover unto the LORD thy God, of the flock and the herd, in the place which the LORD shall choose to place his name there.
verses.ct: You must sacrifice the Passover offering to the LORD your God — from your sheep, goats, or cattle — at the location the LORD will select to establish his name.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt eat no leavened bread with it; seven days shalt thou eat unleavened bread therewith, even the bread of affliction; for thou camest forth out of the land of Egypt in haste: that thou mayest remember the day when thou camest forth out of the land of Egypt all the days of thy life.
verses.ct: Don't eat any bread made with yeast along with it. For 7 days you must eat bread without yeast — the bread of hardship — because you left Egypt in a rush. Do this so that every day of your life you will remember the day you came out of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And there shall be no leavened bread seen with thee in all thy coast seven days; neither shall there any thing of the flesh, which thou sacrificedst the first day at even, remain all night until the morning.
verses.ct: No yeast should be found anywhere in your territory for 7 days. Also, none of the meat you sacrifice on the evening of the first day should be left over until morning.

verses.kjv: Thou mayest not sacrifice the passover within any of thy gates, which the LORD thy God giveth thee:
verses.ct: You are not allowed to sacrifice the Passover offering in just any town that the LORD your God gives you.

verses.kjv: But at the place which the LORD thy God shall choose to place his name in, there thou shalt sacrifice the passover at even, at the going down of the sun, at the season that thou camest forth out of Egypt.
verses.ct: Instead, sacrifice the Passover at the location the LORD your God will select to establish his name. Do it in the evening as the sun goes down, at the same time of year that you left Egypt.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt roast and eat it in the place which the LORD thy God shall choose: and thou shalt turn in the morning, and go unto thy tents.
verses.ct: Cook it and eat it at the location the LORD your God will select. Then in the morning, head back to your homes.

verses.kjv: Six days thou shalt eat unleavened bread: and on the seventh day shall be a solemn assembly to the LORD thy God: thou shalt do no work therein.
verses.ct: For 6 days eat bread without yeast, and on the 7th day hold a sacred gathering for the LORD your God. Do no work on that day.

verses.kjv: Seven weeks shalt thou number unto thee: begin to number the seven weeks from such time as thou beginnest to put the sickle to the corn.
verses.ct: Count off 7 weeks for yourself. Start counting the 7 weeks from the time you first begin harvesting the grain.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt keep the feast of weeks unto the LORD thy God with a tribute of a freewill offering of thine hand, which thou shalt give unto the LORD thy God, according as the LORD thy God hath blessed thee:
verses.ct: Then celebrate the Festival of Weeks for the LORD your God by bringing a voluntary offering in proportion to how much the LORD your God has blessed you.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt rejoice before the LORD thy God, thou, and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy manservant, and thy maidservant, and the Levite that is within thy gates, and the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, that are among you, in the place which the LORD thy God hath chosen to place his name there.
verses.ct: Celebrate in the presence of the LORD your God — you, your sons, your daughters, your male and female servants, the Levites living in your towns, the foreigners, the orphans, and the widows among you — at the location the LORD your God has selected to establish his name.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt remember that thou wast a bondman in Egypt: and thou shalt observe and do these statutes.
verses.ct: Remember that you were once slaves in Egypt, and carefully follow these regulations.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt observe the feast of tabernacles seven days, after that thou hast gathered in thy corn and thy wine:
verses.ct: Celebrate the Festival of Shelters for 7 days after you have finished gathering your grain and pressing your grapes.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt rejoice in thy feast, thou, and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy manservant, and thy maidservant, and the Levite, the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, that are within thy gates.
verses.ct: Enjoy this festival — you, your sons, your daughters, your male and female servants, along with the Levites, the foreigners, the orphans, and the widows living in your towns.

verses.kjv: Seven days shalt thou keep a solemn feast unto the LORD thy God in the place which the LORD shall choose: because the LORD thy God shall bless thee in all thine increase, and in all the works of thine hands, therefore thou shalt surely rejoice.
verses.ct: Celebrate this festival for 7 days to honor the LORD your God at the location the LORD will select. The LORD your God will bless all your harvest and everything you do, so you should truly celebrate.

verses.kjv: Three times in a year shall all thy males appear before the LORD thy God in the place which he shall choose; in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tabernacles: and they shall not appear before the LORD empty:
verses.ct: 3 times each year, every male among you must come into the presence of the LORD your God at the location he will select: during the Festival of Unleavened Bread, the Festival of Weeks, and the Festival of Shelters. No one should come into the LORD's presence without an offering.

verses.kjv: Every man shall give as he is able, according to the blessing of the LORD thy God which he hath given thee.
verses.ct: Each person should give whatever he can, based on how generously the LORD your God has blessed him.

verses.kjv: Judges and officers shalt thou make thee in all thy gates, which the LORD thy God giveth thee, throughout thy tribes: and they shall judge the people with just judgment.
verses.ct: Appoint judges and officials for yourselves in every town that the LORD your God gives you, throughout all your tribes. They must judge the people fairly.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not wrest judgment; thou shalt not respect persons, neither take a gift: for a gift doth blind the eyes of the wise, and pervert the words of the righteous.
verses.ct: Never twist justice, never show favoritism, and never accept a bribe — because bribes blind even wise people and corrupt the decisions of those who are righteous.

verses.kjv: That which is altogether just shalt thou follow, that thou mayest live, and inherit the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee.
verses.ct: Pursue complete justice, so that you may thrive and take possession of the land the LORD your God is giving you.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not plant thee a grove of any trees near unto the altar of the LORD thy God, which thou shalt make thee.
verses.ct: Never set up any wooden worship pole beside the altar you build for the LORD your God.

verses.kjv: Neither shalt thou set thee up any image; which the LORD thy God hateth.
verses.ct: Never set up a sacred pillar for worship — the LORD your God despises such things.
